moves.5... Bg7: Brings another piece on the d4 pawn
moves.6. Nf3: protects well positioned pawn on d4
moves.6... Nd7: Removes any threat on d4, but defends f6
moves.7. O-O: pieces are rather well positioned, time to protect the King
moves.7... Ngf6: Brings out knight, preparing to castle
moves.8. Nxf6+ Nxf6 9. Re1: takes control of the half open e file
moves.9... O-O: leaves e7 pawn defended only by the queen.
moves.10. Bf4: takes control of the h2-b8 diagonal
moves.10... b6:
allows Bb7
adds pressure on g7
moves.11. c3: makes way for queen along the d1-a4 diagonal
moves.14... cxd5: mistake: blocks Bishop on b7 completely
moves.15. Ng4: takes ahold of a great position
moves.15... Qh4: attacks both the knight and bishop
moves.16... h5: Pushes the Knight away from its position and therefore uncovers the unprotected bishop on f4.
moves.17. Bg3: attacks Queen and removes threat of Ne5, Qxf4
moves.20. Re3: mistake, Rd3 is better and keeps the rook on the e file attacking the e6 pawn.
moves.23... g5:
removes pin
but weakens pawn formation
moves.27. Bxg7 Qxg7 28. Ne5 Rf6 29. g4 hxg4 30: threatens Qe8+ resulting in big losses for Black
moves.35... Qe7: Moves Queen from blocking path for the King
moves.36. Ng4+: Discovers the e6 pawn to the Rook
